description: An implementation of StyleCop's rules using Roslyn analyzers and code fixes

diagnostics.title: XML comment analysis disabled
diagnostics.description: XML comment analysis can only be performed when the project is configured to parse documentation comments. To enable this functionality, update the project to produce an XML documentation file as part of the build.
diagnostics.messageFormat: XML comment analysis is disabled due to project configuration

diagnostics.title: Invalid settings file
diagnostics.description:
Various errors in the stylecop.json file can prevent the file from being loaded by the analyzers. In this case, the default settings are used instead.

{0}
diagnostics.messageFormat: The stylecop.json settings file could not be loaded

diagnostics.title: Keywords should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: The spacing around a C# keyword is incorrect.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The keyword '{0}' should{1} be followed by a space.

diagnostics.title: Commas should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: The spacing around a comma is incorrect, within a C# code file.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Commas should{0} be {1} by whitespace.

diagnostics.title: Semicolons should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: The spacing around a semicolon is incorrect, within a C# code file.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Semicolons should{0} be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Symbols should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: The spacing around an operator symbol is incorrect, within a C# code file.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Operator '{0}' should be preceded by whitespace.

diagnostics.title: Documentation lines should begin with single space
diagnostics.description: A line within a documentation header above a C# element does not begin with a single space.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Documentation line should begin with a space.

diagnostics.title: Single line comments should begin with single space
diagnostics.description: A single-line comment within a C# code file does not begin with a single space.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Single line comment should begin with a space.

diagnostics.title: Preprocessor keywords should not be preceded by space
diagnostics.description: A C# preprocessor-type keyword is preceded by space.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Preprocessor keyword '{0}' should not be preceded by a space.

diagnostics.title: Operator keyword should be followed by space
diagnostics.description: The operator keyword within a C# operator overload method is not followed by any whitespace.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Operator keyword should be followed by a space.

diagnostics.title: Opening parenthesis should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: An opening parenthesis within a C# statement is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Opening parenthesis should not be preceded by a space.

diagnostics.title: Closing parenthesis should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A closing parenthesis within a C# statement is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Closing parenthesis should{0} be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Opening square brackets should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: An opening square bracket within a C# statement is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Opening square brackets should {0} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Closing square brackets should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A closing square bracket within a C# statement is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Closing square bracket should{0} be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Opening braces should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: An opening brace within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Opening brace should{0} be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Closing braces should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A closing brace within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Closing brace should{0} be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Opening generic brackets should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: An opening generic bracket within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Opening generic brackets should not be {0} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Closing generic brackets should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A closing generic bracket within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Closing generic bracket should{0} be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Opening attribute brackets should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: An opening attribute bracket within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Opening attribute brackets should not be followed by a space.

diagnostics.title: Closing attribute brackets should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A closing attribute bracket within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Closing attribute brackets should not be preceded by a space.

diagnostics.title: Nullable type symbols should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A nullable type symbol within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Nullable type symbol should not be preceded by a space.

diagnostics.title: Member access symbols should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: The spacing around a member access symbol is incorrect, within a C# code file.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Member access symbol '{0}' should not be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Increment decrement symbols should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: An increment or decrement symbol within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: {0} symbol '{1}' should not be {2} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Negative signs should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A negative sign within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Negative sign should{0} be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Positive signs should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A positive sign within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Positive sign should{0} be {1} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Dereference and access of symbols should be spaced correctly
diagnostics.description: A dereference symbol or an access-of symbol within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Dereference symbol '*' should {0}.

diagnostics.title: Colons Should Be Spaced Correctly
diagnostics.description: A colon within a C# element is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Colon should{0} be {1}{2} by a space.

diagnostics.title: Code should not contain multiple whitespace in a row
diagnostics.description: The code contains multiple whitespace characters in a row.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Code should not contain multiple whitespace characters in a row.

diagnostics.title: Code should not contain space after new or stackalloc keyword in implicitly typed array allocation
diagnostics.description: An implicitly typed array allocation within a C# code file is not spaced correctly.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The keyword '{0}' should not be followed by a space or a blank line.

diagnostics.title: Use tabs correctly
diagnostics.description: The code contains a tab or space character which is not consistent with the current project settings.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Tabs and spaces should be used correctly

diagnostics.title: Code should not contain trailing whitespace
diagnostics.description: There should not be any whitespace at the end of a line of code.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Code should not contain trailing whitespace

diagnostics.title: Do not prefix calls with base unless local implementation exists
diagnostics.description: A call to a member from an inherited class begins with 'base.', and the local class does not contain an override or implementation of the member.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Do not prefix calls with base unless local implementation exists

diagnostics.title: Prefix local calls with this
diagnostics.description: A call to an instance member of the local class or a base class is not prefixed with 'this.', within a C# code file.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Prefix local calls with this

diagnostics.title: Query clause should follow previous clause
diagnostics.description: A C# query clause does not begin on the same line as the previous clause, or on the next line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Query clause should follow previous clause.

diagnostics.title: Query clauses should be on separate lines or all on one line
diagnostics.description: The clauses within a C# query expression are not all placed on the same line, and each clause is not placed on its own line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Query clauses should be on separate lines or all on one line

diagnostics.title: Query clause should begin on new line when previous clause spans multiple lines
diagnostics.description: A clause within a C# query expression begins on the same line as the previous clause, when the previous clause spans across multiple lines.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Query clause should begin on new line when previous clause spans multiple lines

diagnostics.title: Query clauses spanning multiple lines should begin on own line
diagnostics.description: A clause within a C# query expression spans across multiple lines, and does not begin on its own line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Query clauses spanning multiple lines should begin on own line

diagnostics.title: Code should not contain empty statements
diagnostics.description: The C# code contains an extra semicolon.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Code should not contain empty statements

diagnostics.title: Code should not contain multiple statements on one line
diagnostics.description: The C# code contains more than one statement on a single line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Code should not contain multiple statements on one line

diagnostics.title: Block statements should not contain embedded comments
diagnostics.description: A C# statement contains a comment between the declaration of the statement and the opening brace of the statement.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Block statements should not contain embedded comments

diagnostics.title: Block statements should not contain embedded regions
diagnostics.description: A C# statement contains a region tag between the declaration of the statement and the opening brace of the statement.

diagnostics.title: Opening parenthesis or bracket should be on declaration line
diagnostics.description: The opening parenthesis or bracket is not placed on the same line as the method/indexer/attribute/array name.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Opening parenthesis or bracket should be on declaration line.

diagnostics.title: Closing parenthesis should be on line of last parameter
diagnostics.description: The closing parenthesis or bracket in a call to or declaration of a C# method/indexer/attribute/array/constructor/delegate is not placed on the same line as the last parameter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Closing parenthesis should be on line of last parameter

diagnostics.title: Closing parenthesis should be on line of opening parenthesis
diagnostics.description: The closing parenthesis or bracket in a call to a C# method or indexer, or the declaration of a method or indexer, is not placed on the same line as the opening bracket when the element does not take any parameters.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Closing parenthesis should be on line of opening parenthesis

diagnostics.title: Comma should be on the same line as previous parameter
diagnostics.description: A comma between two parameters in a call to a C# method or indexer, or in the declaration of a method or indexer, is not placed on the same line as the previous parameter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Comma should be on the same line as previous parameter.

diagnostics.title: Parameter list should follow declaration
diagnostics.description: The start of the parameter list for a method/constructor/indexer/array/operator call or declaration does not begin on the same line as the opening bracket, or on the line after the opening bracket.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Parameter list should follow declaration

diagnostics.title: Parameter should follow comma
diagnostics.description: A parameter within a C# method or indexer call or declaration does not begin on the same line as the previous parameter, or on the next line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The parameter should begin on the line after the previous parameter.

diagnostics.title: Split parameters should start on line after declaration
diagnostics.description: The parameters to a C# method or indexer call or declaration span across multiple lines, but the first parameter does not start on the line after the opening bracket.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The parameters should begin on the line after the declaration, whenever the parameter span across multiple lines

diagnostics.title: Parameters should be on same line or separate lines
diagnostics.description: The parameters to a C# method or indexer call or declaration are not all on the same line or each on a separate line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The parameters should all be placed on the same line or each parameter should be placed on its own line.

diagnostics.title: Parameter should not span multiple lines
diagnostics.description: A parameter to a C# method/indexer/attribute/array, other than the first parameter, spans across multiple lines. If the parameter is short, place the entire parameter on a single line. Otherwise, save the contents of the parameter in a temporary variable and pass the temporary variable as a parameter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The parameter spans multiple lines

diagnostics.title: Statement should not use unnecessary parenthesis
diagnostics.description: A C# statement contains parenthesis which are unnecessary and should be removed.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Statement should not use unnecessary parenthesis

diagnostics.title: Statement should not use unnecessary parenthesis
diagnostics.description: A C# statement contains parenthesis which are unnecessary and should be removed.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Statement should not use unnecessary parenthesis

diagnostics.title: Comments should contain text
diagnostics.description: The C# comment does not contain any comment text.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Comments should contain text

diagnostics.title: Use built-in type alias
diagnostics.description: The code uses one of the basic C# types, but does not use the built-in alias for the type.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Use built-in type alias

diagnostics.title: Use string.Empty for empty strings
diagnostics.description: The C# code includes an empty string, written as "".
diagnostics.messageFormat: Use string.Empty for empty strings

diagnostics.title: Do not place regions within elements
diagnostics.description: The C# code contains a region within the body of a code element.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Region should not be located within a code element.

diagnostics.title: Do not use regions
diagnostics.description: The C# code contains a region.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Do not use regions

diagnostics.title: Use shorthand for nullable types
diagnostics.description: The Nullable<T> type has been defined not using the C# shorthand. For example, Nullable<DateTime> has been used instead of the preferred DateTime?
diagnostics.messageFormat: Use shorthand for nullable types

diagnostics.title: Prefix calls correctly
diagnostics.description: A call to a member is not prefixed with the 'this.', 'base.', 'object.' or 'typename.' prefix to indicate the intended method call, within a C# code file.

diagnostics.title: Generic type constraints should be on their own line
diagnostics.description: Each type constraint clause for a generic type parameter should be listed on a line of code by itself.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Generic type constraints should be on their own line

diagnostics.title: Put constructor initializers on their own line
diagnostics.description: A constructor initializer, including the colon character, should be on its own line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Put constructor initializers on their own line

diagnostics.title: Do not use default value type constructor
diagnostics.description: When creating a new instance of a value type T, the syntax 'default(T)' is functionally equivalent to the syntax 'new T()'. To avoid confusion regarding the behavior of the resulting instance, the first form is preferred.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Do not use default value type constructor

diagnostics.title: Use lambda syntax
diagnostics.description: Lambda expressions are more succinct and easier to read than anonymous methods, so they should are preferred whenever the two are functionally equivalent.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Use lambda syntax

diagnostics.title: Use readable conditions
diagnostics.description: When a comparison is made between a variable and a literal, the variable should be placed on the left-hand-side to maximize readability.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Constant values should appear on the right-hand side of comparisons

diagnostics.title: Do not combine fields
diagnostics.description: Each field should be declared on its own line, in order to clearly see each field of a type and allow for proper documentation of the behavior of each field.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Each field should be declared on its own line

diagnostics.title: Do not combine attributes
diagnostics.description: Each attribute usage should be placed in its own set of square brackets for maximum readability.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Each attribute should be placed in its own set of square brackets.

diagnostics.title: Attributes should not share line
diagnostics.description: Each attribute should be placed on its own line of code.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Each attribute should be placed on its own line of code.

diagnostics.title: Using directives should be qualified
diagnostics.description: All using directives should be qualified.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Using directive for namespace '{0}' should be qualified

diagnostics.title: Enum values should be on separate lines
diagnostics.description: Enum values should be placed on their own lines for maximum readability.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Enum values should be on separate lines

diagnostics.title: Elements should have the same indentation
diagnostics.description: Elements at the same level in the syntax tree should have the same indentation.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Elements should have the same indentation

diagnostics.title: Use literal suffix notation instead of casting
diagnostics.description: Use literal suffix notation instead of casting, in order to improve readability, avoid bugs related to illegal casts and ensure that optimal IL is produced.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Use literal suffix notation instead of casting

diagnostics.title: Using directives should be placed correctly
diagnostics.description: A C# using directive is placed outside of a namespace element.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Using directive should appear within a namespace declaration

diagnostics.title: Elements should appear in the correct order
diagnostics.description: An element within a C# code file is out of order in relation to the other elements in the code.
diagnostics.messageFormat: A {0} should not follow a {1}

diagnostics.title: Elements should be ordered by access
diagnostics.description: An element within a C# code file is out of order in relation to other elements in the code.
diagnostics.messageFormat: '{0}' members should come before '{1}' members

diagnostics.title: Constants should appear before fields
diagnostics.description: A constant field is placed beneath a non-constant field.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Constant fields should appear before non-constant fields

diagnostics.title: Static elements should appear before instance elements
diagnostics.description: A static element is positioned beneath an instance element.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Static members should appear before non-static members

diagnostics.title: Partial elements should declare access
diagnostics.description: The partial element does not have an access modifier defined.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Partial elements should declare an access modifier

diagnostics.title: Declaration keywords should follow order
diagnostics.description: The keywords within the declaration of an element do not follow a standard ordering scheme.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The '{0}' modifier should appear before '{1}'

diagnostics.title: Protected should come before internal
diagnostics.description: The keyword '{0}' is positioned after the keyword '{1}' within the declaration of a {0} {1} C# element.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The keyword '{0}' should come before '{1}'.

diagnostics.title: System using directives should be placed before other using directives
diagnostics.description: A using directive which declares a member of the 'System' namespace appears after a using directive which declares a member of a different namespace, within a C# code file.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Using directive for '{0}' should appear before directive for '{1}'

diagnostics.title: Using alias directives should be placed after other using directives
diagnostics.description: A using-alias directive is positioned before a regular using directive.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Using alias directives should be placed after all using namespace directives.

diagnostics.title: Using directives should be ordered alphabetically by namespace
diagnostics.description: The using directives within a C# code file are not sorted alphabetically by namespace.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Using directives should be ordered alphabetically by the namespaces.

diagnostics.title: Using alias directives should be ordered alphabetically by alias name
diagnostics.description: The using-alias directives within a C# code file are not sorted alphabetically by alias name.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Using alias directive for '{0}' should appear before using alias directive for '{1}'

diagnostics.title: Property accessors should follow order
diagnostics.description: A get accessor appears after a set accessor within a property or indexer.
diagnostics.messageFormat: A get accessor appears after a set accessor within a property or indexer.

diagnostics.title: Event accessors should follow order
diagnostics.description: An add accessor appears after a remove accessor within an event.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Event accessors should follow order.

diagnostics.title: Readonly fields should appear before non-readonly fields
diagnostics.description: A readonly field is positioned beneath a non-readonly field.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Readonly fields should appear before non-readonly fields

diagnostics.title: Using static directives should be placed at the correct location.
diagnostics.description: A using static directive is positioned before a regular or after an alias using directive.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Using static directives should be placed at the correct location.

diagnostics.title: Using static directives should be ordered alphabetically
diagnostics.description: All using static directives should be ordered alphabetically.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The using static directive for '{0}' should appear after the using static directive for '{1}'

diagnostics.title: Element should begin with upper-case letter
diagnostics.description: The name of a C# element does not begin with an upper-case letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element '{0}' should begin with an uppercase letter

diagnostics.title: Element should begin with lower-case letter
diagnostics.description: There are currently no situations in which this rule will fire.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element should begin with lower-case letter

diagnostics.title: Interface names should begin with I
diagnostics.description: The name of a C# interface does not begin with the capital letter I.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Interface names should begin with I

diagnostics.title: Const field names should begin with upper-case letter
diagnostics.description: The name of a constant C# field should begin with an upper-case letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Const field names should begin with upper-case letter.

diagnostics.title: Non-private readonly fields should begin with upper-case letter
diagnostics.description: The name of a non-private readonly C# field should being with an upper-case letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Non-private readonly fields should begin with upper-case letter

diagnostics.title: Field names should not use Hungarian notation
diagnostics.description: The name of a field or variable in C# uses Hungarian notation.
diagnostics.messageFormat: {0} '{1}' should not use Hungarian notation

diagnostics.title: Field names should begin with lower-case letter
diagnostics.description: The name of a field in C# does not begin with a lower-case letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Field '{0}' should begin with lower-case letter

diagnostics.title: Accessible fields should begin with upper-case letter
diagnostics.description: The name of a public or internal field in C# does not begin with an upper-case letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Field '{0}' should begin with upper-case letter

diagnostics.title: Variable names should not be prefixed
diagnostics.description: A field name in C# is prefixed with 'm_', 's_', or 't_'.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Field '{0}' should not begin with the prefix '{1}'

diagnostics.title: Field names should not begin with underscore
diagnostics.description: A field name in C# begins with an underscore.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Field '{0}' should not begin with an underscore

diagnostics.title: Field names should not contain underscore
diagnostics.description: A field name in C# contains an underscore.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Field '{0}' should not contain an underscore

diagnostics.title: Static readonly fields should begin with upper-case letter
diagnostics.description: The name of a static readonly field does not begin with an upper-case letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Static readonly fields should begin with upper-case letter

diagnostics.title: Variable names should begin with lower-case letter
diagnostics.description: The name of a variable in C# does not begin with a lower-case letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Variable '{0}' should begin with lower-case letter

diagnostics.title: Parameter names should begin with lower-case letter
diagnostics.description: The name of a parameter in C# does not begin with a lower-case letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Parameter '{0}' should begin with lower-case letter

diagnostics.title: Type parameter names should begin with T
diagnostics.description: The name of a C# type parameter does not begin with the capital letter T.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Type parameter names should begin with T

diagnostics.title: Access modifier should be declared
diagnostics.description: The access modifier for a C# element has not been explicitly defined.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element '{0}' should declare an access modifier

diagnostics.title: Fields should be private
diagnostics.description: A field within a C# class has an access modifier other than private.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Field should be private

diagnostics.title: File may only contain a single type
diagnostics.description: A C# code file contains more than one unique type.
diagnostics.messageFormat: File may only contain a single type

diagnostics.title: File may only contain a single namespace
diagnostics.description: A C# code file contains more than one namespace.
diagnostics.messageFormat: File may only contain a single namespace

diagnostics.title: Code analysis suppression should have justification
diagnostics.description: A Code Analysis SuppressMessage attribute does not include a justification.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Code analysis suppression should have justification

diagnostics.title: Debug.Assert should provide message text
diagnostics.description: A call to Debug.Assert in C# code does not include a descriptive message.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Debug.Assert should provide message text

diagnostics.title: Debug.Fail should provide message text
diagnostics.description: A call to Debug.Fail in C# code does not include a descriptive message.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Debug.Fail should provide message text

diagnostics.title: Arithmetic expressions should declare precedence
diagnostics.description: A C# statement contains a complex arithmetic expression which omits parenthesis around operators.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Arithmetic expressions should declare precedence

diagnostics.title: Conditional expressions should declare precedence
diagnostics.description: A C# statement contains a complex conditional expression which omits parenthesis around operators.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Conditional expressions should declare precedence

diagnostics.title: Remove unnecessary code
diagnostics.description: A C# file contains code which is unnecessary and can be removed without changing the overall logic of the code.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: Remove delegate parenthesis when possible
diagnostics.description: A call to a C# anonymous method does not contain any method parameters, yet the statement still includes parenthesis.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Remove delegate parenthesis when possible

diagnostics.title: Attribute constructor should not use unnecessary parenthesis
diagnostics.description: TODO.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Attribute constructor should not use unnecessary parenthesis

diagnostics.title: Store files as UTF-8 with byte order mark
diagnostics.description: Source files should be saved using the UTF-8 encoding with a byte order mark
diagnostics.messageFormat: Store files as UTF-8 with byte order mark

diagnostics.title: Use trailing comma in multi-line initializers
diagnostics.description: A multi-line initializer in a C# code file should use a comma on the last line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Use trailing comma in multi-line initializers

diagnostics.title: Braces for multi-line statements should not share line
diagnostics.description: The opening or closing brace within a C# statement, element, or expression is not placed on its own line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Braces for multi-line statements should not share line

diagnostics.title: Statement should not be on a single line
diagnostics.description: A C# statement containing opening and closing braces is written completely on a single line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Statement should not be on a single line

diagnostics.title: Element should not be on a single line
diagnostics.description: A C# element containing opening and closing braces is written completely on a single line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element should not be on a single line

diagnostics.title: Braces should not be omitted
diagnostics.description: The opening and closing braces for a C# statement have been omitted.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Braces should not be omitted

diagnostics.title: All accessors should be single-line or multi-line
diagnostics.description: Within a C# property, indexer or event, at least one of the child accessors is written on a single line, and at least one of the child accessors is written across multiple lines.
diagnostics.messageFormat: All accessors should be single-line or multi-line

diagnostics.title: Opening braces should not be followed by blank line
diagnostics.description: An opening brace within a C# element, statement, or expression is followed by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: An opening brace should not be followed by a blank line.

diagnostics.title: Element documentation headers should not be followed by blank line
diagnostics.description: An element documentation header above a C# element is followed by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element documentation headers should not be followed by blank line

diagnostics.title: Code should not contain multiple blank lines in a row
diagnostics.description: The C# code contains multiple blank lines in a row.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Code should not contain multiple blank lines in a row

diagnostics.title: Closing braces should not be preceded by blank line
diagnostics.description: A closing brace within a C# element, statement, or expression is preceded by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: A closing brace should not be preceded by a blank line.

diagnostics.title: Opening braces should not be preceded by blank line
diagnostics.description: An opening brace within a C# element, statement, or expression is preceded by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Opening braces should not be preceded by blank line.

diagnostics.title: Chained statement blocks should not be preceded by blank line
diagnostics.description: Chained C# statements are separated by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: '{0}' statement should not be preceded by a blank line

diagnostics.title: While-do footer should not be preceded by blank line
diagnostics.description: The while footer at the bottom of a do-while statement is separated from the statement by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: While-do footer should not be preceded by blank line

diagnostics.title: Single-line comments should not be followed by blank line
diagnostics.description: A single-line comment within C# code is followed by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Single-line comments should not be followed by blank line

diagnostics.title: Closing brace should be followed by blank line
diagnostics.description: A closing brace within a C# element, statement, or expression is not followed by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Closing brace should be followed by blank line

diagnostics.title: Element documentation header should be preceded by blank line
diagnostics.description: An element documentation header above a C# element is not preceded by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element documentation header should be preceded by blank line

diagnostics.title: Single-line comment should be preceded by blank line
diagnostics.description: A single-line comment within C# code is not preceded by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Single-line comment should be preceded by blank line

diagnostics.title: Elements should be separated by blank line
diagnostics.description: Adjacent C# elements are not separated by a blank line.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Elements should be separated by blank line

diagnostics.title: Code should not contain blank lines at start of file
diagnostics.description: The code file has blank lines at the start.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Code should not contain blank lines at start of file

diagnostics.title: Use line endings correctly at end of file
diagnostics.description: Code should not contain blank lines at the end of the file
diagnostics.messageFormat: Code should not contain blank lines at the end of the file

diagnostics.title: Braces should not be omitted from multi-line child statement
diagnostics.description: The opening and closing braces for a multi-line C# statement have been omitted.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Braces should not be omitted from multi-line child statement

diagnostics.title: Use braces consistently
diagnostics.description: The opening and closing braces of a chained if/else if/else construct were included for some clauses, but omitted for others.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Use braces consistently

diagnostics.title: Elements should be documented
diagnostics.description: A C# code element is missing a documentation header.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Elements should be documented

diagnostics.title: Partial elements should be documented
diagnostics.description: A C# partial element is missing a documentation header.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Partial elements should be documented

diagnostics.title: Enumeration items should be documented
diagnostics.description: An item within a C# enumeration is missing an Xml documentation header.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Enumeration items should be documented

diagnostics.title: Documentation should contain valid XML
diagnostics.description: The XML within a C# elements document header is badly formed.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The documentation header is composed of invalid XML: {0}

diagnostics.title: Element documentation should have summary
diagnostics.description: The XML header documentation for a C# element is missing a <summary> tag.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element documentation should have summary

diagnostics.title: Partial element documentation should have summary
diagnostics.description: The <summary> or <content> tag within the documentation header for a C# code element is missing or empty.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Partial element documentation should have summary

diagnostics.title: Element documentation should have summary text
diagnostics.description: The <summary> tag within the documentation header for a C# code element is empty.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element documentation should have summary text

diagnostics.title: Partial element documentation should have summary text
diagnostics.description: The <summary> or <content> tag within the documentation header for a C# code element is empty.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Partial element documentation should have summary text

diagnostics.title: Element documentation should not have default summary
diagnostics.description: The <summary> tag within an element's XML header documentation contains the default text generated by Visual Studio during the creation of the element.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element documentation should not have default summary

diagnostics.title: Property documentation should have value
diagnostics.description: The XML header documentation for a C# property does not contain a <value> tag.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Property documentation should have value

diagnostics.title: Property documentation should have value text
diagnostics.description: The XML header documentation for a C# property contains an empty <value> tag.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Property documentation should have value text

diagnostics.title: Element parameters should be documented
diagnostics.description: A C# method, constructor, delegate or indexer element is missing documentation for one or more of its parameters.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The documentation for parameter '{0}' is missing

diagnostics.title: Element parameter documentation should match element parameters
diagnostics.description: The documentation describing the parameters to a C# method, constructor, delegate or indexer element does not match the actual parameters on the element.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The parameter '{0}' does not exist.

diagnostics.title: Element parameter documentation should declare parameter name
diagnostics.description: A <param> tag within a C# element's documentation header is missing a name attribute containing the name of the parameter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element parameter documentation should declare parameter name

diagnostics.title: Element parameter documentation should have text
diagnostics.description: A <param> tag within a C# element's documentation header is empty.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element parameter documentation should have text

diagnostics.title: Element return value should be documented
diagnostics.description: A C# element is missing documentation for its return value.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element return value should be documented

diagnostics.title: Element return value documentation should have text
diagnostics.description: The <returns> tag within a C# element's documentation header is empty.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element return value documentation should have text

diagnostics.title: Void return value should not be documented
diagnostics.description: A C# code element does not contain a return value, or returns void, but the documentation header for the element contains a <returns> tag.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Void return value should not be documented

diagnostics.title: Generic type parameters should be documented
diagnostics.description: A generic C# element is missing documentation for one or more of its generic type parameters.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The documentation for type parameter '{0}' is missing

diagnostics.title: Generic type parameters should be documented partial class
diagnostics.description: A generic, partial C# element is missing documentation for one or more of its generic type parameters, and the documentation for the element contains a <summary> tag.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The documentation for type parameter '{0}' is missing

diagnostics.title: Generic type parameter documentation should match type parameters
diagnostics.description: The <typeparam> tags within the Xml header documentation for a generic C# element do not match the generic type parameters on the element.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The type parameter '{0}' does not exist.

diagnostics.title: Generic type parameter documentation should declare parameter name
diagnostics.description: A <typeparam> tag within the XML header documentation for a generic C# element is missing a name attribute, or contains an empty name attribute.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Generic type parameter documentation should declare parameter name.

diagnostics.title: Generic type parameter documentation should have text
diagnostics.description: A <typeparam> tag within the Xml header documentation for a generic C# element is empty.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Generic type parameter documentation should have text.

diagnostics.title: Property summary documentation should match accessors
diagnostics.description: The documentation text within a C# propertys <summary> tag does not match the accessors within the property.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The property's documentation summary text should begin with: '{0}'

diagnostics.title: Property summary documentation should omit accessor with restricted access
diagnostics.description: The documentation text within a C# propertys <summary> tag takes into account all of the accessors within the property, but one of the accessors has limited access.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Because the property only contains a visible {0} accessor, the documentation summary text should begin with '{1}'.

diagnostics.title: Element documentation should not be copied and pasted
diagnostics.description: The Xml documentation for a C# element contains two or more identical entries, indicating that the documentation has been copied and pasted. This can sometimes indicate invalid or poorly written documentation.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Element documentation should not be copied and pasted

diagnostics.title: Single-line comments should not use documentation style slashes
diagnostics.description: The C# code contains a single-line comment which begins with three forward slashes in a row.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Single-line comments should not use documentation style slashes

diagnostics.title: Documentation text should not be empty
diagnostics.description: The XML header documentation for a C# code element contains an empty tag.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The documentation text within the \'{0}\' tag should not be empty.

diagnostics.title: Documentation text should begin with a capital letter
diagnostics.description: A section of the XML header documentation for a C# element does not begin with a capital letter.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: Documentation text should end with a period
diagnostics.description: A section of the XML header documentation for a C# element does not end with a period.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Documentation text should end with a period

diagnostics.title: Documentation text should contain whitespace
diagnostics.description: A section of the XML header documentation for a C# element does not contain any whitespace between words.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: Documentation should meet character percentage
diagnostics.description: A section of the Xml header documentation for a C# element does not contain enough alphabetic characters.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: Documentation text should meet minimum character length
diagnostics.description: A section of the Xml header documentation for a C# element is too short.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: File should have header
diagnostics.description: A C# code file is missing a standard file header.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The file header is missing or not located at the top of the file.

diagnostics.title: File header should show copyright
diagnostics.description: The file header at the top of a C# code file is missing a copyright tag.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The file header should contain a copyright tag.

diagnostics.title: File header should have copyright text
diagnostics.description: The file header at the top of a C# code file is missing copyright text.
diagnostics.messageFormat: File header should have copyright text

diagnostics.title: File header copyright text should match
diagnostics.description: The file header at the top of a C# code file does not contain the appropriate copyright text.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The file header copyright text should match the copyright text from the settings.

diagnostics.title: File header should contain file name
diagnostics.description: The file header at the top of a C# code file is missing the file name.
diagnostics.messageFormat: File header should contain file name.

diagnostics.title: File header file name documentation should match file name
diagnostics.description: The file attribute within copyright tag of the file header at the top of a C# code file does not contain the name of the file.
diagnostics.messageFormat: File header file name documentation should match file name.

diagnostics.title: File header should have summary
diagnostics.description: The file header at the top of a C# code file does not contain a filled-in summary tag.
diagnostics.messageFormat: File header should have summary

diagnostics.title: File header should have valid company text
diagnostics.description: The file header at the top of a C# code file does not contain company name text.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The copyright tag should contain a non-empty company attribute.

diagnostics.title: File header company name text should match
diagnostics.description: The file header at the top of a C# code file does not contain the appropriate company name text.
diagnostics.messageFormat: The file header company name should match the company name from the settings.

diagnostics.title: Constructor summary documentation should begin with standard text
diagnostics.description: The XML documentation header for a C# constructor does not contain the appropriate summary text.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Constructor summary documentation should begin with standard text

diagnostics.title: Destructor summary documentation should begin with standard text
diagnostics.description: The XML documentation header for a C# finalizer does not contain the appropriate summary text.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Destructor summary documentation should begin with standard text

diagnostics.title: Documentation headers should not contain blank lines
diagnostics.description: A section within the XML documentation header for a C# element contains blank lines.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: Included documentation file does not exist
diagnostics.description: An included XML documentation file does not exist.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: Included documentation XPath does not exist
diagnostics.description: An included XML documentation link contains an invalid path.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: Include node does not contain valid file and path
diagnostics.description: An include tag within an XML documentation header does not contain valid file and path attribute.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: inheritdoc should be used with inheriting class
diagnostics.description: <inheritdoc> has been used on an element that doesn't inherit from a base class or implement an interface.
diagnostics.messageFormat: inheritdoc should be used with inheriting class

diagnostics.title: File name should match first type name
diagnostics.description: The file name of a C# code file does not match the first type declared in the file.
diagnostics.messageFormat: File name should match first type name.

diagnostics.title: Element documentation should be spelled correctly
diagnostics.description: The element documentation for the element contains one or more spelling mistakes or unrecognized words.
diagnostics.messageFormat: TODO: Message format

diagnostics.title: Do not use placeholder elements
diagnostics.description: The element documentation contains a <placeholder> element.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Do not use placeholder elements

diagnostics.title: Do not prefix local calls with 'this.'
diagnostics.description: A call to an instance member of the local class or a base class is prefixed with `this.`.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Do not prefix local calls with 'this.'

diagnostics.title: Field names should begin with underscore
diagnostics.description: A field name in C# does not begin with an underscore.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Field '{0}' should begin with an underscore

diagnostics.title: Static field names should begin with underscore
diagnostics.description: A static field name in C# does not begin with an underscore.
diagnostics.messageFormat: Static field '{0}' should begin with an underscore
